Fuck you you don't know what's up. MS has been progressing toward lockdown for many years while they also try to establish web services. The end point is a kiosk OS, which is not separate from the device. Interactive TV. Eliminating cost and giving everyone free upgrades is a great way to help that process along: You can use Microsoft's latest services UI on all of your devices. (Which is essentially what their latest ads are saying.)

You'd probably know a lot of ATMs are running XP, but you wouldn't know it to look at them. One doesn't go to the bank and pick between an XP ATM or a MacOS
ATM. One just uses the ATM interface to use bank services. It will be the same way with Windows. MS doesn't want you to feel like you've paid for a
vehicle or tool that you own and have a right to
use as you like. They want you to pay them for the usage. (Thus, they now sell "services" and
"experiences", not software.) Just as you don't buy
an ATM. You use the service and pay for that usage.

Essentially Microsoft is hoping to eliminate private cars and force you to use their taxi service. But their plan is even better than that, because they don't deal in hardware. They don't need to produce a million taxi cars to hand out to former car owners. They just have to run the taxi service. You still buy the car. It's not even yours anymore!

The trick is not to offer any other option. So everyone eventually has to buy a services taxi and pay to use it. Get it together /g/

Wykrhm,
no words can begin to describe the hard work you've up into this community. Most of us who have been here for a long time have probably seen your name pop up the most. It's not popping up in a bad way, but rather in a good way thanks to the essential quality you bring to all your posts.
I'm looking through your comment history and all I see is positivity - is this guy for real? Yes I think he is. And his name is wykrhm. "Wykrhm the good guy" is what I like to call you when I'm not browsing reddit and when I talk about you around my friends.
I don't know when you started helping this community but it feels like you've been in it forever. Hence I think your flair as a fundamental suits you well. As the fundamentals were one of the pillars of the dota universe I think you're one, if not the pillar of this subreddit. You started off from scratch and built something amazing with your account. People associate your account and your flair with genuine positivity as well as a source of quality information. "How does he do it?" I think to myself sometimes before I go to sleep. "I don't know, but he's dam good at it anyway" I respond in the Plato-esque dialogue I repeat in my head.
Wykrhm I would like to end this text with a tank you note I found: "from the bottom of my heart I'd like to thank you; but for you my heart has no bottom"
Thank you most beautiful purveyor of reddit aurum! Thank you Wykrhm!
